ca.cgjennings.ui

Class FilteredDocument

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.text.AbstractDocument
      • javax.swing.text.PlainDocument
        • ca.cgjennings.ui.FilteredDocument
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Document

    public class FilteredDocument
extends PlainDocument
    An extension of PlainDocument that transparently filters out certain characters. A set of characters is provided as a string, and the filter operates as either a white list (allowing only characters in the filter string) or a black list (allowing all characters except those in the filter string).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • FilteredDocument

        Creates a filtered document that filters out the characters in the filter list.
        Parameters:
        blackList - the characters to exclude
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if filterList is null

      • FilteredDocument

        public FilteredDocument(String filterList,
                        boolean isWhiteList)
        Creates a filtered document with the specified filter characters and list type.
        Parameters:
        filterList - the characters to include/exclude
        isWhiteList - whether the filter includes or excludes the filter list
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if filterList is null

    • Method Detail

      • createDigitDocument

        public static final PlainDocument createDigitDocument()
        Returns a new document that filters out non-digits.
        Returns:
        a document that accepts only digits

      • createFileNameDocument

        public static final PlainDocument createFileNameDocument()
        Returns a new document that filters out characters that are illegal in Windows, *NIX file names.
        Returns:
        a file name filtering document

      • createFilePathDocument

        public static final PlainDocument createFilePathDocument()
        Returns a new document that filters out characters that are illegal in Windows, *NIX file paths. This is identical to the filter created with createFileNameDocument(), but it does not filter path characters (/, \, and :).
        Returns:
        a file path filtering document

      • createHexDocument

        public static final PlainDocument createHexDocument()
        Returns a new document that accepts hex digits. Alphabetic digits are converted to upper case.
        Returns:
        a document that accepts only hex digits 0-9, a-f, and A-F

      • createJavaNameDocument

        public static final PlainDocument createJavaNameDocument()
        Returns a document that only accepts characters that can appear in a Java class name. Note that the document will not prevent the initial character from being a digit.
        Returns:
        a document that accepts only Java identifier characters

      • createLowerCaseDocument

        public static final PlainDocument createLowerCaseDocument(Locale locale)
        Returns a new document that converts all text to lower case.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale to use for conversion
        Returns:
        a document that allows only lower case, converting if necessary

      • createPropertyKeyDocument

        public static final PlainDocument createPropertyKeyDocument()
        Returns a new document that filters out characters that are escaped in property files.
        Returns:
        a property key filtering document

      • createUpperCaseDocument

        public static final PlainDocument createUpperCaseDocument(Locale locale)
        Returns a new document that converts all text to upper case.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale to use for conversion
        Returns:
        a document that allows only upper case, converting if necessary

      • filterString

        public String filterString(String text)
        Returns the result of filtering a string with the document's filter. As a side effect, the document content will be replaced by the filtered text.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to filter
        Returns:
        the text that remains after applying the filter

      • getFilteredCharacters

        public String getFilteredCharacters()
        Returns the characters being filtered as a string.
        Returns:
        the characters to include/exclude

      • insertString

        public void insertString(int offs,
                         String str,
                         AttributeSet a)
                  throws BadLocationException
        Performs filtering of characters when new text is inserted into the document being calling the super implementation to actually insert the (filtered) text.
        Specified by:
        insertString in interface Document
        Overrides:
        insertString in class PlainDocument
        Parameters:
        offs - offset into the document
        str - the string to insert
        a - attributes for the inserted text (typically null)
        Throws:
        BadLocationException - if the offset is not within the document bounds (0..document.length())
        See Also:
        Document.insertString(int, java.lang.String, javax.swing.text.AttributeSet)

      • isWhiteList

        public boolean isWhiteList()
        Returns true if the filter characters form a white list (list of the allowed characters), or false if they form a black list (list of excluded characters).
        Returns:
        true if the list is a white list

      • onFiltration

        protected void onFiltration(String oldString,
                            String newString)
        Override to react to a string having characters filtered out. The default implementation emits an error beep.
        Parameters:
        oldString - the original string that was to be inserted into the document
        newString - the (possibly empty) filtered string

      • setFilteredCharacters

        public void setFilteredCharacters(String filterList)
        Sets the list of characters to include/exclude.
        Parameters:
        filterList - each character in this string will be excluded or included (depending on whether the set is a whitelist)
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if filterList is null

      • setWhiteList

        public void setWhiteList(boolean isWhiteList)
        Sets whether the list is treated as a white list (true) or black list (false).
        Parameters:
        isWhiteList - true if the filter characters are allowed
